reviews.sentence: You get what you pay for. The Fairfax is a historic hotel and located in beautiful neighborhood with many things to do and see. The room was small and it could have been cleaner. We found hair in the tub the first day we checked in. The sheets were not changed during our five day stay except for the pillowcases. Furthermore the AC kept going out and when the maintenance man was called he hust told us to turn the temp to 60. that did not help. The staff was friendly at the front desk and knowledgeable. They were accommodating as I paid for the wrong day. They allowed us to remain in the same room even though we were supposed to change rooms the last day of our stay. I think that we would have been given a better room if we had not booked with a discount web site. Upon checking the manager had told the front desk clerk that we paid with Expedia and then pointed to the screen gesturing for her to choose something.

Comfortable hotel in excellent location. A very nice hotel with fantastic staff and the area it is in can not be beat. They do not offer room service though which was annoying and the breakfast is very overpriced. it is a very old hotel and though they have updated nicely the heater is insanely loud to the point of waking you out of sound sleep and the windows are not well insulated so the wind was audible. Despite those drawbacks I would stay here again. The staff was exceptional and the bed was one of the best I have slept in.

Great experience. Tip my hat to Expedia for adding value here my VIP package gave me free breakfast buffet a free drink at the bar and free WiFi. These really enhanced the stay. What else gorgeous suite on a corner back side nice and quiet loads of space in drawers nicely appointed bath with exhaust fan. What to update the iHome console needs to include a Lightning adapter still uses the 30pin interface usually I travel with one for lesser hotels but I thought that it would not be needed here. CFL bulbs should update to LED desk chair is too high to fit under the drawer of the desk without impacting the arms. Finally do not overlook the hotel restaurant open very late and well above expectations for an in house venue. See above Close to DuPont circle easy to get anywhere on the Metro from there See above.
Nice hotel in a great location. The Fairfax is a very nice beautiful hotel very convenient to many of DC ’s attractions. The hotel has been updated but still has the historic charm.
Great location and staff. Under renovation but we were lucky and never heard any noise. Wonderful staff and location in Dupont Circle can not be beat.

Location is handy to Dupont Circle with a nice fountain and park only a couple of blocks away. Staff are very friendly and attentive. Rooms are comfortable and kept very clean. Restaurants and bars are plentiful and only a few blocks away. Hotel is undergoing renovations but did not really affect my stay.

Ok room poor amenities and under renovation july 18. Comfortable romgod location 2 blocks from metro station bars restaurants and cvs supermarket. Hotel under renovationPor breakfast amenities under renovation.
Nice and a little dated they were doing renovations which made food and bar services limited so understandable. Not as convenient to most attractions but short Uber ride.
The hotel is in the midst of renovations.
Doing renovations bar breakfast all in temporary housing as was the checkin desk. Very bureaucratic waiters clerks etc. Rooms are good though.

Beautiful historic hotel that has been renovated back to its glory days. Room was small but incredibly comfortable. Bathroom was stunning. Very convenient to DuPont Circle metro station and some great eateries. Hotel is currently being renovated though and so dining options were slim within the hotel itself.

I rarely rate anything with top marks. Than there is nothing to strive for. The property is well located and charming However because of its age things like drafty windows older fixtures although well appointed. The staff always makes me feel at home and the update to the nook and bar are top notch a little pricey for coffee. Overall 4 solid stars.

We had the pleasure of working with Nurlan at the front desk. He was excellent and his professionalism along with the rest of the staff made the Fairfax our number 1 hotel in DC. We wo n’t be staying anywhere else. Renovated property is spectacular in the best location.

Good. The design of the room the spacious of a suite location desk staff very friendly. I felt that housekeeping dropped the ball. Had to ask for more shampoo soap etc. Did not receive water bottles everyday as promised had to ask for more cups for bathroom. I have stayed at much less expensive hotels and these items are always refreshed without asking These items should be replaced each day without requesting them. The cost of renting a movie was ubsurd. Over 230 for each movie rented was outrageous. I did not see that cost listed anywhere and just assumed it would be about 10 for each movie rented. Shame on the hotel for charging that amount. At least post the cost in the room so people are aware or provide hot buttered popcorn for that cost.

Great building staff needs some work. The renovation is gorgeous and room was comfortable with fridge and great shower. The staff could use some renovation as well. There were a number of missteps which they seemed unconcerned about addressing. We needed to store our luggage since our room was not ready. When we claimed it the bags were handed to us including coats and shopping bags. No offer of assisting us to our room was made and no cart was available. We got up to our room the key did not work. We asked the housekeeper outside the room if she would let us in and showed her our key folio. She said we had to go back downstairs. Rather than taking all of the bags back downstairs I chose to go solo and have the kids stay with the bags in the hallway. When I got to the front desk and told them the key did not work the desk clerk took the keys and gave me new ones without saying anything. The next day we needed towels and shampoo for three of us to shower in the morning. I called with our request. 20 minutes went by and no one showed up. Plan B was to go outside our room and take what we needed off the housekeeping cart. When we checked out no one asked how our stay was thanked us for staying or offered a goodbye please return. With all the money spent on making the hotel great it would have made sense to have allocated money on staff retraining.
Exceptional. I love the renovations and the friendly staff.

Hotel Fairfax. Beautiful hotel updated rooms. Had a problem with the air conditioner and we were promptly upgraded to another room. We would not hesitate to book another stay here. Not far from major museums and the National Zoo. Nice restaurants within walking distance.

Nice hotel. Convenient location for me. I liked the breakfast option and the newly renovated bar restaurant area so much quieter than anything else in the neighborhood. Coffee maker in my room did not work despite my mentioning it at the front desk. Also the thermostat was set ridiculously low around 60 in a hot spell when I changed it to 76 was changed back the next day very wasteful.

Great location needs some updates. Facilities were really nice the main lobby areas of the hotel were recently remodeled and look very nice. Bed was very comfortable. Many of the bellhops and front door staff were often just standing around even obstructing the doorway as we came and went. The rooms have not been redecorated to match the new modern lobby.

Favorite place to stay in DC. I have stayed here twice in the last few years and have just booked another stay in April 2020. Great location just a few blocks from the Dupont circle. great places nearby to eat. This location recently remodeled area of the hotel. Prices reasonable for the atmosphere and quality given. Staff friendly and professional and rooms are clean and well appointed.
